intro: Chrysocephalum canescens, commonly known as the silver everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and yellow flower heads. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its ornamental value and hardy nature make it a popular choice for native gardens.
